name: treatment of bilge oil, hazardous waste incineration, with energy recovery | electricity, medium voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27104/documentation

Inventoried waste contains 100% bilge oil; . waste composition (wet, in ppm): upper heating value 4.098 MJ/kg; lower heating value 1.92 MJ/kg; H2O 900000; O 1300; H 10000; C 84000; S 3650; N 1000; P 0.0004; B n.a.; Cl n.a.; Br n.a.; F n.a.; I n.a.; Ag n.a.; As n.a.; Ba n.a.; Cd n.a.; Co n.a.; Cr n.a.; Cu n.a.; Hg n.a.; Mn n.a.; Mo n.a.; Ni 0.079; Pb 0.001; Sb n.a.; Se n.a.; Sn n.a.; V 33.1; Zn n.a.; Be n.a.; Sc n.a.; Sr n.a.; Ti n.a.; Tl n.a.; W n.a.; Si 0.6; Fe 2.8; Ca 0.6; Al n.a.; K n.a.; Mg n.a.; Na 3.5; Share of carbon in waste that is biogenic 0%. Net energy produced in HWI: 17.11MJ/kg thermal energy and 1.27MJ/kg electric energy. Allocation of energy production: no substitution or expansion. 100% of burden allocated to waste disposal function of HWI. One kg of this waste produces 0.001425 kg of residues, which are landfilled. Additional solidification with 0.0005702 kg of cement.

waste-specific air and water emissions from incineration, auxiliary material consumption for flue gas cleaning. Short-term emissions to river water and long-term emissions to ground water from residual material landfill (from solidified fly ashes and scrubber slugde). Process energy demands for HWI.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Transfer coefficients for modern Swiss MSWI. Emission speciation based on early 90ies data.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Specific to the technology encountered in Switzerland in 2000. Well applicable to modern incineration practices in Europe or North America or Japan.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Swiss HWI plant in 2000 with wet flue gas scrubber and low-dust SCR DeNOx facility. Gross thermal efficiency 74.4% and gross electric efficiency 10%.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Available waste composition data. Transfer coefficients from one modern HWI completed with data from MSWI. Waste-specific auxiliary material consumption adapted from MSWI. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The 2 Swiss HWI plants, used as the inventory reference technology mix, have a total annual capacity of 53'000 tons of hazardous waste. This corresponds to 39% of the Swiss total installed capacity in 2000. Swiss average plants size is 20'000 t/a.

flow.name: electricity, medium voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution
